description.narrative: Project Title: Synergic Action for Social Change  Problem Analysis: Accordingly to the Strategic planning and program developming workshops done with Alumni representatives and networks, the key issues were identified such; poor cooperation of citizens on the role of citizenship, lack of democratic culture/ practice, lack of rule of law and good naural resurces managemtn, the inter-ethnic/religion tension as the main problems. The programmes has two main components such; 1) Youth & Sangha for Peace and justice and 2) Green Youth Movement.  Component 1) Objective: Public awareness and engagement towards peaceful culture and tolerant society in Myanmar. Expected Results: 1) to promote peace culture in pluralistic socity through Youth Peace Leaders, 2) to promote activie citizenship through leadershp, empowerment and active participation in democracy and 3) to strengthen Sangha leadership for positive social change. Component 2) Objective: Emergence of green youth movments for environmental justice and natural resource issues. Expected Result: 1) to enhance public participation in advcoacy process on revision of some environmental laws and law enforcement cases through watchdog mechanism by Green Youth Network and 2) to establish inspiring eco-freindly models & establish young farmers networks as mechanism to address food soveriegity issues. Main activities- The program  would conduct Youth peace leadershop trainings/support, peace education trainings/workshops and Youth leadershop trainings/support for the sake of peacful culture and tolerant society. On the other hand, the program would also promote the particpation of public in advocacy process of environmental laws revisons and law enforcement by training the youths to set up watchdog mechanism and train the young farmers about the eco-friendly farming methods to set up the cooperatives for food soveriegnty and natural resource managment. Thematic areas: Peace, Human Rights, Agricultre, Environment, Natural resource management
This project mainly contributes to results within Peace building. Results will be reported later in the Global Civsam grant period 2016-2020
